page.description: Sends an email message using the Mandrill mail delivery service. The minimum set of properties in a dot variable to pass in are: .send_to, .message_html, .subject, .from_email

argument.name: messageSettings
argument.description: An object containing the following message settings:

property.name: from_name
property.description: Friendly name to use in the from field.

return.name: Result
return.description: A dot variable contains information about the success of the email_send_mandrill function.

section.title: Sender Name Alias
section.description: Support for specifying an alias for the sender name has been added. The dot variable that is passed into the email_send_mandrill() function can now have a .from_name property. For example:

section.example: 'create a .dot variable to define the message dim ms as p ms.send_to = "john@acme.com:John Smith,sally@acme.com:Sally Jones" ms.from_email = "sales@alpha.com" ms.from_name = "Sales at Alpha" 'friendly name - optional ms.subject = "Information You Requested" ms.message_html = "Here is the information you requested." dim pResult as p pResult = email_send_mandrill("mysecretkey",ms)
